channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023120664
item.description:
Report X-2023120664

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on load side wet, taken to cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was an inner box with 2 x 5.0 liters plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part A. The 1 plastic bottle was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters spill out. The other 2 x 5.0-liter plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part B were not damaged. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The one x 5.0-liter plastic bottle of Rapicide PA Part A was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red lined tote to contain the leaking damaged hazmat, taken to cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120667
item.description:
Report X-2023120667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer # 244146 already damage wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Zep calcium lime rust remover 1 gallon bottle had loose cap allowing .5 gallons to release. package had no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 gallon plastic bottle of zep calcium lime rust remover had loose cap allowing .5 gallon to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024010102
item.description:
Report X-2024010102

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING PROPER PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED. USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONCE SHEETS FOR 1.4S. BOX WAS ON FLOOR IN DA. AREA BOX WAS SOILED AND WET ON BOTTOM. NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ABSORBANT.PLACE BOX IN GREEN PLASTIC D.M.P. BAG AND REMOVED TO D.M.P FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023120838
item.description:
Report X-2023120838

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in Unload. Box was wet when retrieved. Upon further investigation bottle of Hydrogen peroxide leaked inside box. Placed package inside Hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: Box was most likely placed, or fell, on its side during shipping. Cap on it was not properly secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in the Hazmat Cage, within a Hazmat bin to prevent any effects.

Report X-2023120832

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found one trailer# 831257 already wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of paramount super concentrated machine dishwash both had loose lids allowing .5 gallon to release from each bottle. package had no slotted partitions, bags or absorbent. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of paramount super concentrated machine dishwash both had loose lids allowing .5 gallon to release from each bottle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED WEARING PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER OBSERIVING THE LEAKER, FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP AND RESPONDS. AFTER CLEAN UP, RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE HAZMAT TO THE DMP FOR FURITHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box were wet and brought to QA to be inspected by an admin. DescribePack: The container's cap wasn't fully on. It was lopsided. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright in a tote when it was processed. I fixed the cap and moved it into a drum.

Report X-2023120884

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in Unload. Box was wet when retrieved. Package was taken and properly stored in the Hazmat Cage. DescribePack: Upon further investigation, two bottles of stain remover had loose caps and leaked within box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a Hazmat bin to prevent any other releases.

item.title: Report E-2023120451
item.description:
Report E-2023120451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: BIRDSBORO
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1/2 cup of sodium dichromate dihydrate (UN3288) released from a 50 lb paper bag due to improper packaging. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided that it would be cleaned by terminal staff using appropriate PPE. (1) 30gallon poly DF was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
